<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:15PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Item&nbsp;9.
<A NAME="D126671D10K_HTM_TX126671_15">
</A>
	Changes in and Disagreements With Accountants on Accounting and Financial
	Disclosure
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	None.
</P>
</EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:21PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:15PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Item&nbsp;9A.
<A NAME="D126671D10K_HTM_TX126671_16">
</A>
	Controls
	and Procedures
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Senior management of Dominion Midstream&#146;s general partner, Dominion Midstream GP, LLC, including its CEO and CFO, evaluated the
	effectiveness of Dominion Midstream&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this report. Based on this evaluation process, the CEO and CFO of Dominion Midstream&#146;s general partner have concluded that
	Dominion Midstream&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures are effective. There were no changes in Dominion Midstream&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the last fiscal quarter that have materially affected, or
	are reasonably likely to materially affect, Dominion Midstream&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	M
<SMALL>
	ANAGEMENT
</SMALL>
	&#146;
<SMALL>
	S
</SMALL>
	A
<SMALL>
	NNUAL
</SMALL>
	R
<SMALL>
	EPORT
</SMALL>
<SMALL>
	ON
</SMALL>
	I
<SMALL>
	NTERNAL
</SMALL>
	C
<SMALL>
	ONTROL
</SMALL>
	O
<SMALL>
	VER
</SMALL>
	F
<SMALL>
	INANCIAL
</SMALL>
	R
<SMALL>
	EPORTING
</SMALL>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management of Dominion Midstream&#146;s general partner
	understands and accepts responsibility for Dominion Midstream&#146;s financial statements and related disclosures and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting (internal control). Dominion Midstream continuously strives to
	identify opportunities to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of internal control, just as Dominion Midstream does throughout all aspects of its business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion Midstream maintains a system of internal control designed to provide reasonable assurance, at a reasonable cost, that its assets are
	safeguarded against loss from unauthorized use or disposition and that transactions are executed and recorded in accordance with established procedures. This system includes written policies, an organizational structure designed to ensure
	appropriate segregation of responsibilities, careful selection and training of qualified personnel and internal audits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Audit
	Committee of the Board of Directors of Dominion Midstream&#146;s general partner, composed entirely of independent directors, meets periodically with the independent registered public accounting firm, the internal auditors and management to discuss
	auditing, internal control, and financial reporting matters of Dominion Midstream and to ensure that each is properly discharging its responsibilities. Both the independent registered public accounting firm and the internal auditors periodically
	meet alone with the Audit Committee and have free access to the Committee at any time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	SEC rules implementing Section&nbsp;404 of the
	Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 require Dominion Midstream&#146;s 2015 Annual Report to contain a management&#146;s report and a report of the independent registered public accounting firm regarding the effectiveness of internal control. As a basis for
	the report, Dominion Midstream tested and evaluated the design and operating effectiveness of internal controls. Based on its assessment as of December&nbsp;31,
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2015, Dominion Midstream&#146;s general partner makes the following assertions:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management is responsible for establishing and maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting of Dominion Midstream.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There are inherent limitations in the effectiveness of any internal control, including the possibility of human error and the circumvention or
	overriding of controls. Accordingly, even effective internal controls can provide only reasonable assurance with respect to financial statement preparation. Further, because of changes in conditions, the effectiveness of internal control may vary
	over time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management evaluated Dominion Midstream&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. This
	assessment was based on criteria for effective internal control over financial reporting described in
<I>
	Internal Control-Integrated Framework (2013)
</I>
	&nbsp;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission. Based on
	this assessment, management believes that Dominion Midstream maintained effective internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion Midstream&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm is engaged to express an opinion on Dominion Midstream&#146;s internal
	control over financial reporting, as stated in their report which is included herein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In April 2015, Dominion Midstream acquired DCG.
	Dominion Midstream excluded all of the acquired DCG business from the scope of management&#146;s assessment of the effectiveness of Dominion Midstream&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. DCG constituted 17%
	of Dominion Midstream&#146;s total revenues for 2015 and 14% of Dominion Midstream&#146;s total assets as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	February&nbsp;26,
	2016
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:97%; MARGIN-TOP:1.5%; MARGIN-LEFT:1.5%; MARGIN-RIGHT:-1.25%">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:7.5PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="100%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:7.5PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	67
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<BR CLEAR="ALL">
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D126671D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:15PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	R
<SMALL>
	EPORT
</SMALL>
	O
<SMALL>
	F
</SMALL>
	I
<SMALL>
	NDEPENDENT
</SMALL>
	R
<SMALL>
	EGISTERED
</SMALL>
	P
<SMALL>
	UBLIC
</SMALL>
	A
<SMALL>
	CCOUNTING
</SMALL>
	F
<SMALL>
	IRM
</SMALL>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the Board of Directors of Dominion Midstream GP, LLC and Members of
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion Midstream Partners, LP
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Richmond, Virginia
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have audited the internal control over financial reporting of Dominion Midstream Partners, LP and subsidiaries (&#147;Dominion Midstream&#148;) at
	December 31, 2015, based on criteria established in
<I>
	Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework (2013)
</I>
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission. As described in Management&#146;s Annual Report on Internal
	Control over Financial Reporting, management excluded from its assessment the internal control over financial reporting at Dominion Carolina Gas Transmission, LLC (&#147;DCG&#148;), which was acquired April 1, 2015, and whose financial statements
	constitute 17% of total revenues and 14% of total assets of the consolidated financial statement amounts at and for the year ended December 31, 2015. Accordingly, our audit did not include the internal control over financial reporting at DCG.
	Dominion Midstream&#146;s management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included in the accompanying
	Management&#146;s Annual Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on Dominion Midstream&#146;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards
	require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal control
	over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk, and performing such other procedures as we considered
	necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A company&#146;s internal control
	over financial reporting is a process designed by, or under the supervision of, the company&#146;s principal executive and principal financial officers, or persons performing similar functions, and effected by the company&#146;s board of directors,
	management, and other personnel to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A
	company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets
	of the company; (2) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company
	are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#146;s
	assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Because of the inherent limitations of internal control over
	financial reporting, including the possibility of collusion or improper management override of controls, material misstatements due to error or fraud may not be prevented or detected on a timely basis. Also, projections of any evaluation of the
	effectiveness of the internal control over financial reporting to future periods are subject to the risk that the controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may
	deteriorate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In our opinion, Dominion Midstream maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting
	at December 31, 2015, based on the criteria established in
<I>
	Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework (2013)
</I>
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated
	financial statements at and for the year ended December 31, 2015 of Dominion Midstream and our report dated February 26, 2016 expressed an unqualified opinion on those financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	/s/ Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Richmond, Virginia
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	February 26, 2016
</P>
</EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:21PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="D126671D10K_HTM_TX126671_18">

	Part III
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">

<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:15PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Item&nbsp;10.
<A NAME="D126671D10K_HTM_TX126671_19">
</A>
	Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Management of Dominion Midstream
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We are managed and operated by
	the Board of Directors and executive officers of our general partner, Dominion Midstream GP, LLC, an indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of Dominion. As a result of owning our general partner, Dominion appoints all members of the Board of Directors of
	our general partner. Our unitholders will not be entitled to elect our general partner or its directors or otherwise directly participate in our management or operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Board of Directors of our general partner currently has five members and has determined that Joseph M. Rigby, John W. Snow and David A.
	Wollard are independent under the independence standards of the NYSE. The NYSE does not require a listed publicly traded partnership, such as ours, to have a majority of independent directors on the Board of Directors of our general partner or to
	establish a compensation committee or a nominating committee. However, the Board of Directors of our general partner has established an Audit Committee and a Conflicts Committee to address conflict situations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion Midstream does not have any employees, nor does our general partner. All of the employees that conduct our business are employed by
	affiliates of Dominion, and our general partner secures the personnel necessary to conduct our operations through its services agreements. We will reimburse our general partner and its affiliates for the associated costs of obtaining the personnel
	necessary for our operations pursuant to our partnership agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Directors and Executive Officers of Our General
	Partner
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table shows information for the directors and executive officers of our general partner. Directors hold office until
	their successors have been elected or qualified or until the earlier of their death, resignation, removal or disqualification. Executive officers serve at the discretion of the Board of Directors. There are no family relationships among any of our
	directors or executive officers. Some of our directors and all of our executive officers also serve as executive officers of Dominion.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR BGCOLOR="#E5E5E5" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:7.5PT">

	David A. Wollard
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:0.77EM; TEXT-INDENT:-0.77EM; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Thomas F. Farrell II
</I>
	has served as the Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO of our general partner since March
	2014 and President since February 2015. Mr.&nbsp;Farrell has also served as the Chairman of the Board of Directors, President and CEO of Dominion from April 2007 to date. He has also served as Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO of Virginia
	Power from February 2006 to date and Dominion Gas from September 2013 to date. Mr.&nbsp;Farrell also serves as a director of Altria Group, Inc.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mr.&nbsp;Farrell&#146;s qualifications to serve as a director include his significant and
	extensive industry experience as well as his legal expertise, having served as General Counsel for Dominion and as a practicing attorney with a private firm. Mr.&nbsp;Farrell also has extensive community and public interest involvement and serves or
	has served on many non-profit and university foundations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Mark F. McGettrick
</I>
	has served as a director, Executive Vice President
	and CFO of our general partner since March 2014. Mr.&nbsp;McGettrick has also served as Executive Vice President and CFO of Dominion and Virginia Power from June 2009 to date and Dominion Gas from September 2013 to date. Mr.&nbsp;McGettrick has
	served as a director of Virginia Power from June 2009 to date and Dominion Gas from September 2013 to date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mr.&nbsp;McGettrick&#146;s
	qualifications to serve as a director include his more than 35 years of utility management and industry experience. He recently served on the George Mason University board of visitors and is on the Board of Directors of the Dominion Foundation.
	Mr.&nbsp;McGettrick also has community and public interest involvement and serves or has served on many non-profit foundations and boards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Joseph M. Rigby
</I>
	has served as a director of our general partner since October 2014. Mr. Rigby has been chairman, president and CEO
	since May 2009 of PHI, an energy delivery company serving the Mid-Atlantic region. Mr. Rigby received his bachelor&#146;s degree in accounting from Rutgers University and an MBA from Monmouth University. He is also a licensed Certified Public
	Accountant in the state of New Jersey.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mr.&nbsp;Rigby&#146;s qualifications to serve as a director include his 37 years of experience
	with PHI and its subsidiaries and in the utility industry. As the CEO of PHI, he has leadership, corporate management, governance, and regulatory experience, among other business disciplines. He also has finance, human resources, and mergers and
	acquisitions experience through positions held with PHI and its subsidiaries. Mr.&nbsp;Rigby serves on the boards of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, the Edison Electric Institute and Energy Insurance Mutual and serves or has served on other non-profit
	foundations and boards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	John W. Snow
</I>
	has served as a director of our general partner since October 2014. Mr.&nbsp;Snow is the
	non-executive chairman of the board of Cerberus Capital Management, L.P. He is also a member of the Board of Directors of Armada Hoffler Properties, Inc. and Marathon Petroleum Corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Snow previously served on the boards of
	International Consolidated Airlines Group, S.A. (2010 through 2013), Amerigroup Corporation (2010 through 2012), Verizon Communications, Inc. (2007 through 2012) and Lending Processing Servicing, Inc. (2013).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mr.&nbsp;Snow served as U.S. Secretary of the Treasury from February 2003 until June 2006. Prior to becoming Secretary of the Treasury, he
	served as chairman and CEO of CSX Corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Snow received a bachelor&#146;s degree from the University of Toledo, a master&#146;s degree from Johns Hopkins University, a doctorate in economics from the University of Virginia and a juris
	doctor degree from George Washington University.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mr.&nbsp;Snow&#146;s qualification to serve as a director includes experience as
	chairman of a leading private investment firm and his experience as the U.S. Secretary of the Treasury and as the chairman and CEO of a large public company. Through his current and former service on the boards of directors of other public companies
	and as a CEO, he brings leadership, corporate
</P>

</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	management, governance, finance, and regulatory experience, among other business disciplines.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	David A. Wollard
</I>
	has served as a director of our general partner since October 2014. Mr.&nbsp;Wollard is founding chairman of the
	board, emeritus, Exempla Healthcare (1997 to 2001). Mr.&nbsp;Wollard has served as a director of Dominion since 1999 and currently serves on the CGN Committee. He served as director of Vectra Bank Colorado until January 2016. Mr.&nbsp;Wollard is the
	past chairman of the Downtown Denver Partnership and the Denver Metro Chamber of Commerce. He received his undergraduate degree from Harvard College and graduated from the Stonier Graduate School of Banking. Mr.&nbsp;Wollard held a variety of
	executive positions with banking institutions in Florida and Colorado, where he was the president of Bank One Colorado, N.A.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mr.&nbsp;Wollard&#146;s qualifications to serve as a director include his extensive background in the banking industry. He has held executive
	positions and has been a director of numerous financial institutions. Mr.&nbsp;Wollard also has regulatory and governmental experience which is beneficial as the energy industry continues to face legislative and regulatory scrutiny. He has also
	served on the board of, and has held leadership positions with, many non-profit organizations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	David A. Christian
</I>
	has served as
	Executive Vice President of our general partner since January 2016. Mr.&nbsp;Christian has also served as the Executive Vice President and CEO-Energy Infrastructure Group of Dominion since January 2016, President and COO of Virginia Power since June
	2009 and President of Dominion Gas since January 2016. Mr.&nbsp;Christian previously served as the Executive Vice President and CEO-Dominion Generation Group of Dominion from February 2013 to December 2015 and Executive Vice President of Dominion
	from April 2006 to February 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Michele L. Cardiff
</I>
	has served as the Vice President, Controller and Chief Accounting Officer of
	our general partner since March 2014, Dominion and Virginia Power since April 2014 and Dominion Gas since March 2014. Ms.&nbsp;Cardiff previously served as the Vice President&#151;Accounting of DRS from January 2014 to March 2014, Vice President and
	General Auditor of DRS from September 2012 to December 2013, and Controller of Virginia Power from June 2009 to August 2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Robert M.
	Blue
</I>
	has served as Senior Vice President&#151;Law, Regulation &amp; Policy of our general partner since February 2016. Mr. Blue has also served as Senior Vice President&#151;Law, Regulation &amp; Policy of Dominion and Dominion Gas since
	February 2016 and President of Virginia Power since January 2016. Mr. Blue previously served as Senior Vice President&#151;Regulation, Law, Energy Solutions and Policy of Virginia Power from May 2015 to December 2015, and our general partner,
	Dominion, and Dominion Gas from July 2015 to January 2016.&nbsp;He also served as President of Virginia Power from January 2014 to May 2015, and Senior Vice President&#151;Law, Public Policy and Environment of Dominion from January 2011 to December
	2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Paul E. Ruppert
</I>
	has served as Senior Vice President&#151;Dominion Midstream Operations of our general partner since January
	2016. Mr.&nbsp;Ruppert previously served as Senior Vice President&#151;Business Development&nbsp;&amp; Generation Construction of Virginia Power from April 2012 to December 2015 and Senior Vice President of DTI from June 2009 to March 2012.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Section&nbsp;16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To our knowledge, no executive officer, director or 10% beneficial owner failed to file, on a timely basis, the reports required by Section&nbsp;16(a) of the
	Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, with the exception of one late Form 3 filed for Mr.&nbsp;Blue due to an inadvertent clerical error. Mr.&nbsp;Blue became a Section&nbsp;16 officer of the
	general partner in July 2015, and his Form 3 was filed in October 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Audit Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The members of the Audit Committee are David A. Wollard (chairman), Joseph M. Rigby and John W. Snow. Each member of the Audit Committee has been determined
	independent by the Board of Directors in accordance with NYSE listing standards and SEC regulations. The Board of Directors has also determined that Messrs. Wollard, Rigby and Snow are &#147;audit committee financial experts&#148; as defined under
	SEC rules. Our Audit Committee assists the Board of Directors in its oversight of the integrity of our financial statements and our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements and partnership policies and controls. Our Audit Committee has the
	sole authority to retain and terminate our independent registered public accounting firm, approve all auditing services and related fees and the terms thereof, and pre-approve any non-audit services and tax services to be rendered by our independent
	registered public accounting firm. Our Audit Committee has a written charter adopted by the Board of Directors of our general partner, which is available on our website at http://www.dommidstream.com/assets/pdf/mlp-audit-committee-charter.pdf.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Conflicts Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The members of the Conflicts Committee are
	Joseph M. Rigby (chairman) and John W. Snow. The Conflicts Committee reviews specific matters that the Board of Directors believes may involve conflicts of interest and determines to submit to the Conflicts Committee for review. The Conflicts
	Committee determines if the resolution of the conflict of interest is adverse to the interest of Dominion Midstream. The members of the Conflicts Committee may not be officers or employees of our general partner or directors, officers or employees
	of its affiliates, including Dominion, and must meet the independence standards established by the NYSE and the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, to serve on an audit committee of a board of directors, along with other requirements in our
	partnership agreement. Any matters approved by the Conflicts Committee will be conclusively deemed to be approved by us and all of our partners and not a breach by our general partner of any duties it may owe us or our unitholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Code of Ethics and Corporate Governance Guidelines
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion
	Midstream&#146;s general partner has adopted a Code of Ethics that applies to its principal executive, financial and accounting officers, as well as its employees. This Code of Ethics is available on our website at
	http://dommidstream.com/assets/pdf/mlp-code-of-ethics-and-business-conduct.pdf. We have also adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines that outline the important policies and practices regarding our governance. The Corporate Governance Guidelines are
	available on our website at http://www.dommidstream.com/assets/pdf/mlp-corporate-governance-guidelines.pdf. You may also request a copy of the Code of Ethics, the Corporate Governance Guidelines or any
</P>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	other governance document at no charge, by writing to: Corporate Secretary, 120 Tredegar Street, Richmond, Virginia 23219. Any waivers or changes to the Code of Ethics will be posted on the
	Dominion Midstream website.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Executive Sessions and Communications with Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our independent directors hold regularly scheduled executive sessions without management present. Under our Corporate Governance Guidelines, executive
	sessions are chaired by an independent lead director or, if no lead director has been appointed, then the Chair of the Audit Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have established a procedure by which unitholders or interested parties may communicate with the non-management directors by writing to
	them at the following address: Board of Directors, c/o Corporate Secretary, Dominion Midstream Partners, LP, P.O. Box 26532, Richmond, VA, 23261.
</P>
</EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:21PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_COMPENSATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:15PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Item&nbsp;11.
<A NAME="D126671D10K_HTM_TX126671_20">
</A>
	Executive
	Compensation
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	C
<SMALL>
	OMPENSATION
</SMALL>
	C
<SMALL>
	OMMITTEE
</SMALL>
	R
<SMALL>
	EPORT
</SMALL>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In preparation for filing this Annual Report on Form 10-K, Dominion&#146;s CGN Committee reviewed and discussed the following CD&amp;A with management. Based
	on this review and discussion, the CGN Committee recommended to the Board of Directors of our general partner that the CD&amp;A be included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This report was prepared by the
	following independent directors who compose the CGN Committee:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	David A. Wollard,
<I>
	Chairman
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	William P. Barr
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	John W. Harris
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mark J. Kington
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Robert H. Spilman, Jr.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	I
<SMALL>
	NTRODUCTION
</SMALL>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We do not directly employ
	any of the executive officers, who are employed by Dominion. All determinations with respect to their compensation and benefits are made by the CGN Committee or by Dominion&#146;s CEO as applicable under Dominion&#146;s compensation governance
	policies, without any input from us, our general partner or its Board of Directors (other than awards that may be granted under the long-term incentive plan adopted by our general partner, as noted below). Our executive officers&#146; compensation
	and benefits are paid by Dominion and a portion of that compensation is allocated to and reimbursed by us in accordance with the services agreement between us and Dominion. Our executive officers participate in employee benefit plans and
	arrangements sponsored by Dominion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our general partner has adopted the Dominion Midstream LTIP, pursuant to which certain of our
	officers and other Dominion employees who make significant contributions to Dominion Midstream may receive awards. None of our officers or other Dominion employees received any award under this plan in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with SEC rules, our CEO, CFO and three other most-highly compensated executive officers receiving at least $100,000 in
	compensation attributable to Dominion Midstream for 2015 are our NEOs subject to disclosure in this Item&nbsp;11. Mr.&nbsp;Koonce is our only other executive officer who
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	received at least $100,000 in Dominion Midstream compensation for 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
<I>
	Compensation Discussion and Analysis
</I>
	and
<I>
	Executive Compensation
</I>
	sections of Dominion&#146;s 2016 Proxy Statement will include additional discussion of Dominion&#146;s compensation policies and programs. Dominion&#146;s 2016 Proxy
	Statement will be available upon its filing on the SEC&#146;s website at http://www.sec.gov and on Dominion&#146;s website at http://www.dom.com/investors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Compensation Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion&#146;s executive
	compensation program supports its business goals by rewarding performance that serves customers and creates shareholder value. The following CD&amp;A describes the executive compensation program, focusing on our NEOs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For 2015, our NEOs are:
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Thomas F. Farrell II,
</B>
	Chairman, President and CEO
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>

</B>
	Executive Vice President and CFO
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

	Paul D. Koonce,
</B>

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All of our NEOs are also NEOs of Dominion for 2015. The amounts reported in this Item&nbsp;11 are part of, not in addition to, the
	aggregate compensation amounts that are reported for these NEOs in Dominion&#146;s 2016 Proxy Statement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Compensation Philosophy
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion applies pay-for-performance principles to provide a competitive total compensation program tied to results that align with the interests of
	shareholders, officers and customers. The major objectives of the executive compensation program are to:
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Attract, develop and retain an experienced and highly qualified management team;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Motivate and reward superior performance that supports Dominion&#146;s business and strategic plans and contributes to the long-term success of the company;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Align the interests of management with those of Dominion&#146;s shareholders and customers by placing a substantial portion of pay at risk through performance goals that, if achieved, are expected to increase TSR and
	enhance customer service;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Promote internal pay equity; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Reinforce Dominion&#146;s four core values of safety, ethics, excellence and One Dominion &#150; Dominion&#146;s term for teamwork.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To determine if the program is meeting these objectives, the CGN Committee compares the company&#146;s actual performance to its short-term and long-term
	goals and to peer companies&#146; performance.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:97%; MARGIN-TOP:1.5%; MARGIN-LEFT:1.5%; MARGIN-RIGHT:-1.25%">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:7.5PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="6%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="88%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="6%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:7.5PT">

	&nbsp;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition to considering Dominion&#146;s goals and performance, the CGN Committee also considers several individual
	factors for each NEO, including:
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Job performance
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Scope, complexity and significance of job responsibilities
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Internal pay equity considerations, such as relative importance of a particular position or individual officer to Dominion&#146;s strategy and success, and comparability to other officer positions at Dominion
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Experience, background and tenure
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Retention and market competitive concerns
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The executive&#146;s role in any succession plan for other key positions
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	These individual factors are
	important considerations in setting base pay and short- and long-term compensation opportunities.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	A
<SMALL>
	T
</SMALL>
	R
<SMALL>
	ISK
</SMALL>
	C
<SMALL>
	OMPENSATION
</SMALL>
	O
<SMALL>
	PPORTUNITIES
</SMALL>
<SMALL>
	IN
</SMALL>
	2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Consistent with Dominion&#146;s objective to reward strong performance based on achievement of short- and long-term goals, a
	significant portion of total cash and total direct compensation is at risk. Approximately 88% of Mr.&nbsp;Farrell&#146;s targeted 2015 total direct compensation is performance-based, tied to pre-approved performance metrics, including relative TSR
	and ROIC, or tied to the performance of Dominion&#146;s stock. For the other NEOs of Dominion, performance-based and stock-based compensation ranges from 67% to 79% of targeted 2015 total direct compensation. This compares to an average of
	approximately 55% of targeted compensation at risk for Dominion officers at the vice president level and an average of approximately 12% of total pay at risk for Dominion&#146;s non-officer employees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The charts below illustrate the elements of targeted total direct compensation opportunities in 2015 for Mr.&nbsp;Farrell and the average of
	the other Dominion NEOs as a group and the allocation of such compensation among base salary, targeted 2015 AIP award and targeted 2015 long-term incentive
	compensation.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/26/0001193125-16-480864_G126671G92X05.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:9PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Compensation Elements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion&#146;s executive compensation program is constructed of four building blocks: base pay, AIP, long-term incentive program and executive benefits. Each
	element serves a distinct purpose. These complementary components appropriately balance risk with reward and short-term goals with long-term strategies, while providing total compensation that is competitive with peer companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	B
<SMALL>
	ASE
</SMALL>
	S
<SMALL>
	ALARY
</SMALL>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Competitive
	base pay is necessary to attract, motivate and retain talent. For NEOs, base salaries are generally targeted at or slightly above the Compensation Peer Group median, subject to the individual and company-wide considerations discussed above under
<I>
	Compensation Philosophy
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The CGN Committee approved base salary increases for officers, including a 3% increase for Messrs.
	Farrell and Koonce in recognition of the company&#146;s continued performance. The CGN Committee also approved a 10% increase for Mr.&nbsp;McGettrick in recognition of superior performance, the successful implementation of Dominion Midstream and the
	highly competitive market for chief financial officer talent. The base salary increases were each effective March&nbsp;1, 2015.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	A
<SMALL>
	NNUAL
</SMALL>
	I
<SMALL>
	NCENTIVE
</SMALL>
	P
<SMALL>
	LAN
</SMALL>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The AIP is a cash-based program focused on short-term goals, and it is designed to:
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Tie interests of shareholders, customers and employees closely together
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Focus Dominion&#146;s workforce on company, operating group, team and individual goals that ultimately influence operational and financial results
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Reward corporate and operating unit earnings performance
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Reward safety, diversity and other operating and stewardship goal successes
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Emphasize teamwork by focusing on common goals
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Provide a competitive total compensation opportunity
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the NEOs, funding of the 2015 AIP was tied solely to
	the achievement of predetermined earnings per share goals. However, the CGN Committee retained discretion to reduce the AIP payout for any NEO for any reason, including missed business unit financial targets or failure to satisfy operating and
	stewardship goals.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:97%; MARGIN-TOP:1.5%; MARGIN-LEFT:1.5%; MARGIN-RIGHT:-1.25%">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:7.5PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D126671D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The CGN Committee calculated 2015 AIP payouts for the NEOs as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/26/0001193125-16-480864_G126671G29Q43.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:9PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_39"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Target Award Percentage
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Each NEO&#146;s compensation opportunity under the AIP is a percentage of his base salary. AIP target award percentages are set to be consistent with
	Dominion&#146;s intent to keep a significant portion of NEO compensation at risk, taking into account the items described above under
<I>
	Compensation Philosophy
</I>
	. There were no changes to any NEO&#146;s AIP target award percentage from 2014 to
	2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="74%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="23%">
</TD>

</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:6PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00PT SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00PT SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<BR>

</TD>

</TD>

	Paul D. Koonce
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="16" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<I>
	*As
</I>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	a percentage of base salary
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Funding Level
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For NEOs, the funding level is determined solely by consolidated operating earnings, which are Dominion&#146;s reported earnings determined in accordance with
	GAAP, adjusted for certain items. The company believes that focus on pre-established consolidated operating earnings per share targets encourages behavior and performance that will help achieve these objectives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the NEOs, the CGN Committee set the consolidated operating earnings goal to provide for 100% funding of the 2015 AIP between $3.35 and
	$3.62 per share, inclusive of funding for all plan participants. The target for maximum funding of 200% was set at $3.85 operating earnings per share. The CGN Committee also established a funding floor, providing no funding if operating earnings
	were less than $3.30 per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion&#146;s consolidated operating earnings for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were $2.0
	billion or $3.44 per share*, which met the target goal for 100% funding, and consolidated reported earnings in accordance with GAAP for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were $1.9 billion or $3.20&nbsp;per&nbsp;share. However, Dominion did not
	meet its 2015 earnings guidance, due in part to lower wholesale power prices in New England, where its Millstone and Manchester Street power stations operate; lower prices for the natural gas liquids Dominion produces; and mild weather late in the
	year. Accordingly, the CGN Committee exercised its negative discretion, approving a funding percentage of 20%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	*Reconciliation of 2015 Consolidated
	Operating Earnings to Reported Earnings. The following items, which are net of tax, are included in Dominion&#146;s 2015 reported earnings, but are excluded from consolidated operating earnings: $52 million charge associated with Virginia
	legislation enacted in February that required the write-off of Virginia Power prior-period deferred fuel costs during the first
</I>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	quarter of 2015; $60 million charge associated with the AROs for ash ponds and landfills at certain utility generation facilities in connection with the enactment of EPA coal combustion residuals
	rules in the second quarter of 2015; $17 million net charge in connection with the State Corporation Commission of Virginia&#146;s final ruling associated with its biennial review of Virginia Power&#146;s base rates for 2013-2014 test years; $12
	million net expense related to other items.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Payout Goal Score
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In determining whether and how to exercise its negative discretion, the CGN Committee typically considers each NEO&#146;s accomplishment of pre-determined
	business unit financial goals and operating and stewardship goals, weighted according to each NEO&#146;s responsibilities. For 2015, in light of the low funding level approved for the 2015 AIP, the CGN Committee considered only accomplishment of
	safety goals for each NEO.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Each NEO received full credit for his safety goal. With respect to Messrs. Farrell and McGettrick, the DRS
	business unit met its safety goal of fewer than four OSHA recordable incidents or fewer than 19 failures in individual performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mr.&nbsp;Koonce was part of the Dominion Virginia Power and Dominion Energy business units in 2015. His safety goal was measured by a
	combination of the OSHA recordable rate and lost-time/ restricted duty rate for each business unit, in addition to each business unit&#146;s implementation of plans to evaluate and reduce safety risks. His safety goal was fully achieved, with the
	Dominion Virginia Power business unit attaining an OSHA recordable incident rate of 1.19 and a lost-time/restricted duty rate of 0.31, and the Dominion Energy business unit attaining an OSHA incident rate of 1.12 and a lost-time/restricted duty rate
	of 0.43.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Each NEO therefore received a payout goal score of 100%.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="6%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="88%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="6%">

</TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Note: The NEOs perform services for more than one subsidiary of
	Dominion. Compensation included in this table reflects only the applicable portion related to their service for Dominion Midstream.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:9PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	D
<SMALL>
	OMINION
</SMALL>
	&#146;
<SMALL>
	S
</SMALL>
	L
<SMALL>
	ONG
</SMALL>
	-T
<SMALL>
	ERM
</SMALL>
	I
<SMALL>
	NCENTIVE
</SMALL>
	P
<SMALL>
	ROGRAM
</SMALL>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dominion&#146;s long-term incentive program is designed to focus on longer-term strategic goals and
	the retention of executives. Each year, NEOs receive a long-term incentive award consisting of two components: 50% of the award is a full value equity award in the form of restricted stock with time-based vesting and the other 50% is a
	performance-based cash award. Dominion believes restricted stock serves as a strong retention tool and also creates a focus on its stock price to further align the interests of officers with the interests of shareholders and customers.
	Performance-based awards encourage and reward officers for making decisions and investments that create and maintain long-term shareholder value and benefit customers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The CGN Committee approves long-term incentive awards in January. In setting long-term award levels for each NEO, the CGN Committee applies
	the concepts and individual factors discussed above under
<I>
	Compensation Philosophy
</I>
	. The CGN Committee approved an increase in Mr.&nbsp;Farrell&#146;s long-term incentive award target for 2015 in recognition of the complexity of Dominion&#146;s
	operations, earnings growth over the prior three-year period and shareholder value created during his tenure as CEO, as well as his leadership experience, accomplishments and other individual performance factors. There were no changes to the
	long-term incentive targets for any of the other NEOs. The 2015 targets for the NEOs were approved as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Note: The NEOs perform services for more than one subsidiary of Dominion. Compensation included in this table reflects only
	the applicable portion related to their service for Dominion Midstream.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	2015 Restricted Stock Grants
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All NEOs received a restricted stock grant on February&nbsp;1, 2015, based on the stated dollar value above. The number of shares awarded was determined by
	dividing the stated dollar value by the closing price of Dominion&#146;s common stock on January&nbsp;30, 2015. The grants have a three-year vesting term, with cliff vesting at the end of the restricted period on February&nbsp;1, 2018. Dividends are
	paid to officers during the restricted period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	2015 Performance Grants
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In January 2015, the CGN Committee approved cash performance grants for the NEOs, effective February&nbsp;1, 2015 (2015
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Performance Grants). The performance period commenced on January&nbsp;1, 2015, and will end on December&nbsp;31, 2016. The 2015 performance grants are denominated as a target dollar value, with
	potential payouts ranging from 0% to 200% of the target based on Dominion&#146;s TSR relative to the Philadelphia Stock Exchange Utility Index and ROIC, weighted equally. (See
<I>
	Performance
</I>
<I>
	Grant Peer Group
</I>
	for additional information
	about the Philadelphia Stock Exchange Utility Index.) In certain circumstances, a portion of the 2015 performance grants may also be earned based on Dominion&#146;s absolute TSR performance for the performance period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	TSR is the difference between the value of a share of common stock at the beginning and end of the two-year performance period, plus
	dividends paid as if reinvested in stock. The TSR metric was selected to focus officers on long-term shareholder value when developing and implementing strategic plans and reward management based on the achievement of TSR levels relative to the
	Performance Grant Peer Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ROIC reflects the company&#146;s total return divided by average invested capital for the performance
	period. The ROIC goal at target is consistent with the strategic plan and annual business plan as approved by the Board. For this purpose, total return is the company&#146;s consolidated operating earnings plus its after-tax interest and related
	charges, plus preferred dividends. The ROIC metric was selected to reward officers for the achievement of expected levels of return on the company&#146;s investments. Dominion believes an ROIC measure encourages management to choose the right
	investments, and with those investments, to achieve the highest returns possible through prudent decisions, management and cost control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Because officers are expected to retain ownership of shares upon vesting of restricted stock awards, as explained in
<I>
	Share Ownership
	Guidelines,
</I>
	the cash performance grant balances the long-term program and allows a portion of the long-term incentive award to be accessible to NEOs during the course of their employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:14PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Officers who have not achieved 50% of their targeted share ownership guideline receive goal-based stock performance grants instead of a cash
	performance grant. Dividend equivalents are not paid on any performance-based grants. As Messrs. Farrell, McGettrick and Koonce have each met their full targeted share ownership guidelines, they each received the performance-based component of their
	2015 long-term incentive award in the form of a cash performance grant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Performance Grant Peer Group
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	TSR performance for the 2015 performance grant is measured against the TSR of the companies listed as members of the
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PT; FONT-SIZE:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:97%; MARGIN-TOP:1.5%; MARGIN-LEFT:1.5%; MARGIN-RIGHT:-1.25%">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:7.5PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>

	Philadelphia Stock Exchange Utility Index at the end of the performance period (the Performance Grant Peer Group). In selecting the Philadelphia Stock Exchange Utility Index, the CGN Committee
	took into consideration that the companies represented in the index are similar to those companies currently included in Dominion&#146;s Compensation Peer Group, and the index is a recognized published index whose members are determined externally

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	2014 Performance Grant Payout
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In February 2016, final payouts were made to officers who received cash performance grants in February 2014 (2014 performance grants), including the NEOs. The
	2014 performance grants were based on two goals: TSR for the two-year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, relative to the companies in the Philadelphia Stock Exchange Utility Index as of the end of the performance period (weighted 50%) and ROIC for
	the same two-year period (weighted 50%).
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="16" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<I>
	*
</I>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	TSR weighting is interpolated between the top and bottom of the percentages within a quartile. If the company&#146;s relative TSR is below the 25th percentile, but its absolute TSR is at least 9% on a compounded
	annual basis for the performance period, a goal achievement of 25% of the TSR percentage will apply. In addition to the foregoing amounts and regardless of the company&#146;s relative TSR, if the company&#146;s absolute TSR on a compounded annual
	basis for the performance period is either (i)&nbsp;at least 10% but less than 15%, then an additional 25% will be added to the goal achievement percentage or (ii)&nbsp;at least 15%, then an additional 50% will be added to the goal achievement
	percentage, provided that the aggregate goal achievement may not exceed 200%.
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Actual relative TSR performance for the 2014-2015 period
	was in the 26
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	percentile, which produced a goal achievement percentage of 52.6%. Dominion&#146;s TSR for the two-year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, was 6.1%.
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	%&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="16" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<I>
	*
</I>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	ROIC percentage payout is interpolated between the top and bottom of the percentages for any range.
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:3%; FONT-SIZE:9.5PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Actual ROIC performance for the 2014-2015 period was 7.00%, which produced a goal achievement percentage of 100%. Based on the achievement of
	the TSR and ROIC performance goals, the CGN Committee approved a 76.3% payout for the 2014 Performance Grants, determined as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
